revised_title: The Connection between Oppositely Disposed Air Currents and Subsequent Weather in the British Islands
tldr: The author investigates the connection between oppositely directed air currents and the weather experienced in the British Islands. By examining 27 instances of case I and 30 instances of case II, the study reveals that case I indicates a deep-seated atmospheric disturbance, while case II is not typically indicative of serious weather disturbances.
